Articles.Content:
Eterno-Rest 2000 (REST)

Tragic disasters happen in the world of rocketry now and then, give your highest achieving Kerbals the burial they deserve with this pressurized coffin!
Now includes a contract to launch a dead crew member into space.

By zer0Kerbal, originally by Aphtonites with Acea_

Preamble by Acea_

All honors to Aphtonites, author of the original Eterno-Rest 2000 on SpacePort.

This is an UNOFFICIAL update version of that mod, a simple coffin model, used as a memorial of your brave Kermans who got KIA or MIA.

Original version description by Aphtonites

Tragic disasters happen in the world of rocketry now and then, give your highest achieving Kerbals the burial they deserve with this pressurized coffin!

Once you get it into space (and hopefully in a circular orbit) you can rename the satellite it’s mounted on to the name of the Kerbal who passed away, so they’ll never be forgotten.

Edited October 26, 2022 by zer0Kerbal
update links and lasso the birds
Thread moved from Add-On Development to Add-On Releases. Spooky.

So just for a lark... I wrote a contract.

 

and I launched a probe and the contract completed. 

An now the professor rests Among the Stars

The contract still has some glitches that need to be ironed out. It needs to update the Persistent Data Store with the names of the kerbals that have been launched otherwise  it just keeps cycling through the dead. 

More work on this tomorrow I think.

@zer0Kerbal I've sent you a pull request with the completed contract. I managed to get it working better than I imagined. Feel free to use it as you see fit. 

Edited October 19, 2022 by Caerfinon

5 hours ago, Caerfinon said:

@zer0Kerbal I've sent you a pull request with the completed contract. I managed to get it working better than I imagined. Feel free to use it as you see fit. 

@Caerfinon wonderful!  Thank you +1 

I will release it shortly - and probably also adapt it over to Hallowe'en's Koffin as well!

15 hours ago, James Kerman said:

Thread moved from Add-On Development to Add-On Releases. Spooky.

Thank you @James Kerman!

 

and 

 

BOO!
I don't usualy lose kerbals but now i want to just for this mod.

hmm... with KSP2's announcement today, me thinks that this might be the first addon I update to KSP2... it's going to be needed...

Edited October 22, 2022 by zer0Kerbal

Version 1.3.0.0-release <Caerfinon's contract>

Released 25 Oct 2022 for Kerbal Space Program 1.12.3 by zer0Kerbal

DO A CLEAN INSTALL:
DELETE EXISTING INSTALLATION THEN RE-INSTALL

Download from CurseForge

Add

Spoiler
  • <InterSidera.cfg> v1.0.0.0
    • Add contract to launch a dead crew member into space
    • Parameters:
      • Contract looks for dead crew members and selects one at random to send into space.
      • On successful completion of the orbit the dead Kerbal has it's type changed from crew to unowned.
      • This has the effect of making the dead Kerbal invisible in the astronaut complex and unelectable for future runs of this contract
      • The Kerbal still remains in the roster in the persistent.sfs file.
    • thank you to @Caerfinon{caerfinon}
    • needs to be localized
    • closes #50 - Contract to Launch a dead crew member into space
    • updates #51 - Localize contract
  • Agent strings
    • <en-us.cfg> v1.0.1.0
    • <no-no.cfg> v1.0.1.0
    • updates #13 - Localization - Master

Status 1.3.0.0

  • Issues
    • closes #48 - Eterno-Rest 2000 (REST) 1.3.0.0-release <caerfinon's contract> edition
    • closes #49 - 1.3.0.0 Additional Tasks

Edited October 30, 2022 by zer0Kerbal
update links and lasso the birds

Small change to the contract. I've sent a pull request  @zer0Kerbal

  • minor cosmetic change to the format of the kerbal's name 
  • The part validation parameter had to be changed from SpaceCoffin to  rest-spacecoffin to reflect the new part name. The part and the contract need to be in sync, otherwise the contract cannot complete.

A similar change will be needed in the Hallowe'en (HLWN) mod for the correct part name of the KerbalKoffin

Released 27 Oct 2022 for Kerbal Space Program 1.12.3 by zer0Kerbal

For Best Results, DO A CLEAN INSTALL: DELETE EXISTING INSTALLATION THEN RE-INSTALL

Download from CurseForge

Update

Spoiler
  • <InterSidera.cfg> v1.0.1.0
    • Remove Gender identifiers that were imbedded in the Kerbal name where it appears on screen
    • Change the part validation to use the new part name "rest-spacecoffin"
    • Thank you to @Caerfinoncaerfinon
    • needs to be localized
  • updates #51 - Localize contract
  • closes #57 - Update Contract

Edited October 30, 2022 by zer0Kerbal
update links and lasso the birds

On 10/27/2022 at 11:48 AM, Caerfinon said:

Small change to the contract. I've sent a pull request  @zer0Kerbal

  • minor cosmetic change to the format of the kerbal's name 
  • The part validation parameter had to be changed from SpaceCoffin to  rest-spacecoffin to reflect the new part name. The part and the contract need to be in sync, otherwise the contract cannot complete.

A similar change will be needed in the Hallowe'en (HLWN) mod for the correct part name of the KerbalKoffin 

 

@Caerfinon one redditor asked if the contract can be extended to include the corpse retrieval - I said that it would require a .dll/plugin to convert said kerbal into a part...

10 minutes ago, zer0Kerbal said:

I said that it would require a .dll/plugin to convert said kerbal into a part... 

You'd have to really change the way stock game handles KIA/MIA events. You could have the kerbals in a permanent "Ragdoll" state at the site of the "incident" that to be recovered and  then move them into some kind of crew spot through a PAW action. Once recovered they could be selected for launch into space via coffin. (these are just my first thoughts).

But it really would be quite a bit of work to "unabstract" the current abstraction that we currently have.
